titles: Quakerism no Christianity Clearly and abundantly proved, out of the writings of their chief leaders. With a key, for the understanding their sense of their many usurped, and unintelligible words and phrases, to most readers. In three parts. By John Faldo.
author: Faldo, John, 1633-1690.
publisher: printed by Ben. Griffin and are to be sold by Jo. Robinson at the Golden Lyon in St. Pauls Church-yard, and Rob. Boulter at the Turks-head in Cornhill,
notes: Parts two and three each have separate pagination and register.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Society of Friends --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
